intro: Apocopis paleaceus, commonly known as the paleaceus plant, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale green leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
